com.msc.sampbrowser.query

Class SampQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.msc.sampbrowser.query.SampQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SampQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Provides Methods for retrieving information from a SA-MP Server.
    Author:
    Marcel
    See Also:
    Wiki SA-MP - Query Mechanism

    • Constructor Detail

      • SampQuery

        public SampQuery(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                 int serverPort,
                 int timeout)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Configures the socket and the address that will be used for doing the queries.
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - hostname / ip
        serverPort - port
        timeout - the maximum time, that the socket tries connecting
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the connection is closed unexpectedly / has never beenopened properly

      • SampQuery

        public SampQuery(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                 int serverPort)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Configures the socket and the address.
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - hostname / ip
        serverPort - port
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the connection couldn't be established

      • getBasicServerInfo

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String[]> getBasicServerInfo()
        Returns a String array, containing information about the server.
        Returns:
        String[]:
        Index 0: password (0 or 1)
        Index 1: players
        Index 2: maxplayers
        Index 3: hostname
        Index 4: gamemode
        Index 5: language

      • getBasicPlayerInfo

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String[][]> getBasicPlayerInfo()

        Returns a two dimensional String array of basic player information.

        Every entry in the first dimension equals one player. If you were to retrieve one of those, the rest would look the following:

        String[] playerOne = basicInfo[0];
        String name = playerOne[0] //playername
        String score = playerOne[1] //score
        Returns:
        a two dimensional array containg the basic player information
        See Also:
        getDetailedPlayerInfo()

      • getDetailedPlayerInfo

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String[][]> getDetailedPlayerInfo()

        Returns a two dimensional String array of detailed player information.

        Every entry in the first dimension equals one player. If you were to retrieve one of those, the rest would look the following:

        String[] playerOne = basicInfo[0];
        String id = playerOne[0] //playerid
        String name = playerOne[1] //playername
        String score = playerOne[2] //score
        Returns:
        a two dimensional array containg the detailed player information
        See Also:
        getBasicPlayerInfo()

      • getServersRules

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getServersRules()
        Returns a Map containing all server rules. The Key is always the rules name.
        Returns:
        a Map containing all server rules

      • wrapReply

        private java.nio.ByteBuffer wrapReply(byte[] reply)

        Wraps the received bytes in a ByteBuffer for easier usage.

        Contents of the byte array:
        • Byte 0 - 3: "SAMP"
        • Byte 4 - 7: IP
        • Byte 8 - 9: Port
        • Byte 10: Message Type
        • Byte 11+: Data

        Because the Data contains multiple informations that we do not care for as of now, we are setting the byte buffers initial position to eleven.

        Parameters:
        the - byte array to be wrapped
        Returns:
        the ByteBuffer that wraps the byte array

      • getPing

        public long getPing()
        Returns the server's ping.
        Returns:
        ping

      • receiveBytes

        private byte[] receiveBytes()
        Reseives a package from the server
